trustfund:
TF020195-PHRD-POWER DEVELOPMENT PROJ.,TF023976-FAC CONSULTANT TRUST FUND (USD A/C),TF035840-AFRICA REGION - REGIONAL
            HYDROPOWER PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Regional Hydropower Development
            Project for Mali had the following ratings: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The
            lessons learned indicate that procurement should be
            completed before negotiations. Only one round of bidding,
            properly formatted, should have taken place. The second
            round seems to have distorted the final outcome. Project
            implementation needed better and more timely coordination
            among co-lenders on issues involving procurement and
            processing of payments, since the project's complex
            financing arrangements undermined project execution. The
            Senegal River Basin Organization (OMVS) states need to adopt
            a common health care strategy that would enable them to
            implement a policy focusing on the health problems affecting
            the population living within the Senegal River basin. An
            action program has been implemented to mitigate the
            environmental impacts of construction of the dam, the power
            plant, and the electricity transmission system. Access to
            potable water supply and sanitation, electricity, and health
            services should contribute to the success of poverty
            alleviation schemes undertaken at the local, regional, and
            national levels. The successful experience of OMVS has been
            instrumental in the appointment of the High Commission as
            the secretariat of the African Network for Basin
            Organizations (ANBO).
